page.title: 17SHOPPING FROM BARNSTON
page.content:
During{a one hour survey}at the local shops by Heswall Hills Railway Station it was found that many people visited these shops for forgotten items or for items which were needed immediately. They shopped for bread regularly and liked to deal with the local butcher. Limited choice of goods and higher prices meant that a "big shop" was conducted elsewhere on a regular basis. {A wider survey concluded that main {destinations for the weekly shop were
Heswall {53% } Chester {5.3% Prenton {16% } Neston {2.7% (Sainsburys) Birkenhead{10.7% } Wallasey {1.3% (Asda) Woodchurch {9.3% } West Kirby{1.3% (Leos)
